1.texto: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.

2.descricao:
Cast Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Destroy target attacking creature.

regras.texto: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Eightfold Maze. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
If you're able to cast Eightfold Maze, it can target any attacking creature (including one attacking a planeswalker).

3.descricao: Target opponent skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
3.texto: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

4.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
4.texto:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

5.descricao: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.
5.texto: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.

6.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
If Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into your library.
If a replacement effect has Guan Yu move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

7.texto: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

8.descricao: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.
8.texto:
"Virile in war, he kept the north in fear;
His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

9.texto:
"Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—
Had never been, nor ever was again."

10.descricao: {T}: Kongming's Contraptions deals 2 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

11.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.
11.texto:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
—Liu Bei

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

12.descricao: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

13.descricao: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
13.texto: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

regras.texto: The creature's *owner* gains the life, regardless of who happens to control it.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

14.descricao: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
14.texto:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme
That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

15.descricao: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
15.texto:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

16.descricao:
Cast Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Untap all creatures you control.

17.texto: "Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war." —Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

18.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
18.texto: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

19.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
19.texto: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

20.descricao: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
20.texto: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.

21.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
21.texto: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

22.texto: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

23.descricao: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
23.texto:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
—A Shu diplomat

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

24.texto: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

25.descricao: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

26.descricao: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
26.texto: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

27.descricao: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
27.texto: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.

28.texto:
"Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced."
—Liu Bei, on the death of
his oath-brother Guan Yu

29.descricao: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
29.texto: "The empire belongs to no one man but to all in the empire. He who has virtue shall possess it."

30.texto: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

31.descricao:
Cast Warrior's Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

32.descricao: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
32.texto: Zhang Fei's uncharacteristic alliance with a defeated Riverlands general, Yan Yan, allowed Shu forces to advance through forty-five Riverlands strongpoints with no casualties.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

33.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Zhao Zilong, Tiger General blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
33.texto: Zhao Zilong was a brave and noble warrior. Twice he rescued Liu Bei's son, Liu Shan.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

34.descricao: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.

regras.texto: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

35.descricao: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
35.texto: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

36.texto: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating the Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

37.descricao: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.
37.texto: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

38.descricao: Take an extra turn after this one.
38.texto: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

39.descricao:
Cast Champion's Victory only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.

40.descricao: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.
40.texto: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

41.descricao: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.
41.texto: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

42.descricao: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
42.texto: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

regras.texto: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

44.descricao: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
44.texto:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

45.descricao: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
45.texto: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

46.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
46.texto: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

47.descricao: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
47.texto: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

48.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Lu Xun's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

49.descricao: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.

51.descricao: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
51.texto: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

52.descricao: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
52.texto:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching
(trans. Feng and English)

53.descricao: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
53.texto: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

regras.texto: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, you look at all of them, put one of them into your hand, and put the rest into your graveyard.

54.texto: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

55.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Sun Ce, Young Conquerer enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

56.descricao: Creatures you control have horsemanship. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
56.texto: "One score and four he reigned, the Southland king: / A dragon coiled, a tiger poised below the mighty Yangtze."

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Sun Quan's ability affects Sun Quan itself.

57.descricao: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
57.texto: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.

58.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
58.texto: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

59.texto: The first battle of Hefei was Sun Quan's last as a field general. From then on he let his generals command in the field while he directed battle from behind the front lines.

60.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
60.texto: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

61.descricao: {T}: Wu Longbowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

62.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Wu Scout enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

63.descricao: When Wu Spy enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of target player's library. Put one of them into his or her graveyard.

64.descricao: Wu Warship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
64.texto: Both Wu and Wei warships patrolled the Yangtze River, the natural border between the two kingdoms.

65.descricao: Zhou Yu, Chief Commander can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
65.texto:
"After making me, Zhou Yu, did you have to make Kongming?"
—Zhou Yu crying to heaven on his deathbed

66.descricao: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
66.texto: When Zhuge Jin proposed the marriage of Guan Yu's daugher and Sun Quan's heir, Guan Yu's arrogant refusal led to disaster.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

67.descricao: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
67.texto:
"When you give offense to heaven, to whom can you pray?"
—Cao Cao, quoting Confucius

68.descricao: {T}: Target opponent discards two cards. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

69.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

When Cao Ren, Wei Commander enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
69.texto: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

70.descricao: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
70.texto: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

71.descricao: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

72.descricao: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

73.texto: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

74.descricao: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
74.texto: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

regras.texto: Desperate Charge affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. A creature that enters the battlefield later in the turn won't get +2/+0.

75.descricao: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
75.texto: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

76.texto: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

77.descricao: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.
77.texto: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emporer Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

78.descricao: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
78.texto: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

79.descricao: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
79.texto: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

80.descricao: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
80.texto: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

81.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
81.texto: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

82.descricao: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
82.texto: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.

83.descricao: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent. You gain 5 life.
83.texto: At the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao defeated Yuan Shao by raiding his grain depot, leaving him with no way to feed his troops.

regras.texto: If the targeted opponent is an illegal target by the time Stolen Grain resolves, the ability is countered. You won't gain life.

84.descricao: {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

85.descricao: Whenever Wei Ambush Force attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
85.texto: The battle of Puyang marked the beginning of the end for Lu Bu. He lost the city—and later his life—to Cao Cao.

86.descricao: When Wei Assassins enters the battlefield, target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.

87.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
87.texto: Cao Cao was more concerned with capabilities than lineage. He excelled at recruiting and retaining men of talent to serve him.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

88.texto: Wei won the battle of Hefei when Zhang Liao defeated Sun Quan and then foiled a Wu scheme to incite rebellion.

89.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Wei Night Raiders deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Wei Night Raiders's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

90.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
90.texto:
He will win who, prepared himself, waits to take the enemy unprepared."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

91.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
91.texto: At the battle of Chang'an, Ma Chao defeated the two generals Cao Cao sent to guard the pass but was forced to flee when Cao Cao's trickery turned his own ally against him.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

92.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Sacrifice Xiahou Dun, the One-Eyed: Return target black card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
You can't activate Xiahou Dun's ability to return Xiahou Dun itself to your hand. You must choose a target before you sacrifice Xiahou Dun, so it's not a black card in your graveyard yet.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

93.descricao: {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
93.texto: "A splendid talent, admired of all men! His folly lay in serving Cao Cao's power."

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

94.texto:
"To send the common people to war untrained is to throw them away."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

95.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Zhang He, Wei General attacks, each other creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

96.descricao: Whenever Zhang Liao, Hero of Hefei deals damage to an opponent, that opponent discards a card.

97.texto: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."

98.texto: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."

99.texto: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

100.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
100.texto:
"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

101.texto: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

102.descricao: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
102.texto:
"Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea:
Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

103.descricao: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent.
103.texto:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

104.descricao: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

regras.texto: Burning of Xinye targets only an opponent. If that player is an illegal target by the time Burning of Xinye resolves, the entire spell is countered.
The lands that will be destroyed aren't chosen until Burning of Xinye resolves.

A land with a regeneration shield on it will regenerate from Burning of Xinye's destruction effect. However, the spell or ability that creates that shield must be cast or activated before Burning of Xinye starts to resolve.

In a multiplayer game, only lands controlled by two players (you and the targeted opponent) are destroyed. However, Burning of Xinye will deal 4 damage to each creature, even those controlled by other players.

As Burning of Xinye resolves, first you destroy four lands you control (all at the same time), then the targeted opponent destroys four lands he or she controls (all at the same time). That player chooses which of his or her lands to destroy. Neither of you can choose to destroy a land with indestructible.

105.descricao: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
105.texto: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

106.descricao: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

regras.texto: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it will have to target itself.

107.descricao: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.
107.texto: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

108.descricao: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

109.descricao: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.

110.descricao: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.
110.texto: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

111.descricao: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
111.texto: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

112.descricao: Sacrifice Fire Bowman: Fire Bowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

113.descricao: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

114.texto: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

115.descricao: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
115.texto: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

116.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it can't be blocked this combat.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

117.texto: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.

118.descricao: When Ravaging Horde enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
118.texto: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.

119.descricao: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
119.texto: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

regras.texto: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

120.texto: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."

121.descricao: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

122.descricao: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.

123.texto: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

124.descricao: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
124.texto:
"If I fail, my head is yours."
—Warrior's oath common
during the Three Kingdoms period

125.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Yellow Scarves Cavalry can't block.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

126.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Yellow Scarves General can't block.
126.texto: Zhang Jue, leader of the Yellow Scarves rebellion, was a Taoist master and tutored his soldiers in those arts.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

127.texto: Over 500,000 commoners followed Zhang Jue, General of Heaven, in his attempt to overthrow the corrupt Han dynasty.

128.descricao:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

129.descricao: Whenever Yuan Shao's Infantry attacks alone, Yuan Shao's Infantry can't be blocked this combat.

130.texto: ". . . Jiang Wei alone still strove with might and main: / Nine times more he fought the north—in vain. . . ."

131.descricao: When Zodiac Dragon is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return it to your hand.
131.texto: ". . . The kingdoms three are now the stuff of dream, / For men to ponder, past all praise or blame."

regras.texto: If Zodiac Dragon is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, you can't return it to your hand. Similarly, if a replacement effect has Zodiac Dragon move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.
Even though Zodiac Dragon is a Dragon, it doesn't have flying.

132.texto: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."

133.descricao: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.

134.descricao: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
134.texto: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

135.texto:
Fish and bear paws—one can't have both.
—Chinese idiom meaning
"you can't have it both ways"

136.descricao:
Cast Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.

regras.texto: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Heavy Fog. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
Heavy Fog prevents only damage that would be dealt to you by attacking creatures. It won't prevent damage attacking creatures would deal to creatures or planeswalkers you control.

Heavy Fog prevents all damage attacking creatures would deal to you this turn, not just combat damage. Noncombat damage from those creatures is prevented only if they're still attacking at the time that damage would be dealt or, if the creature has left the battlefield by then, if it was an attacking creature at the time it left.

137.descricao: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

regras.texto: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

138.descricao: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Hunting Cheetah's ability allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Forest, not just a card with the name Forest.

139.descricao: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
139.texto:
"A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you."
—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu

regras.texto: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

140.descricao: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

141.descricao: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.

142.descricao: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
142.texto: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.

143.texto: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

144.descricao: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)
144.texto:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the
Dilu brings its master ill fortune

regras.texto: The spell's effect has no duration. The targeted creature gets +2/+2 until the game ends or it leaves the battlefield. It has horsemanship until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose horsemanship.

145.descricao: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
145.texto:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

regras.texto: When Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, the ability will trigger just once no matter how many creatures are blocking it.

146.texto: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

147.descricao: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Spoils of Victory allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest, not just a card with one of those names.

148.texto: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

149.descricao: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
149.texto: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

150.descricao: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
150.texto: Taoists chose to be hermits for many reasons, but all shared one unchanging goal: to follow the Tao.

151.descricao: Taoist Mystic can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
151.texto: By appearing in places miles apart at the same time, Zuo Ci exhibited the mystic's ability to "shrink the land."

152.descricao: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
152.texto: Incensed by their opponents' unrelenting taunts, even wise generals were known to rashly lead their troops into battle—often to disastrous defeats.

153.descricao: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
153.texto:
"Trying to meet a worthy man in the wrong way is as bad as closing the door on an invited guest."
—Mencius, a Chinese philosopher

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Three Visits allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Forest, not just a card with the name Forest.

154.descricao: Whenever Trained Cheetah becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
154.texto: "King Mulu's cheetahs came riding on the winds, charging, with fangs bared and claws flexed."

155.texto: To taunt a man into action, call him a coward. To insult him beyond forgiveness, call him a jackal.

156.texto: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

157.descricao: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
157.texto: Named for the eastern part of the sky, the source of energy and renewal, Guan Yu's crescent-moon blade weighed over 100 pounds.

158.descricao: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

159.texto: ". . . ‘First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."

160.descricao: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
160.texto:
". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi
Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."

161.texto: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

162.texto: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."

163.texto: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he Kongming not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."

164.texto: ". . . Three kings no more—Chenliu, Guiming, Anle. / The fiefs and posts must now be filled anew. . . ."

165.descricao:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
